description.narrative: To promote and facilitate sustainable development and management of the Havana Bay by the implementation of innovative approaches for reducing the input of priority international waters contaminants
Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay especially nutrients with efficiency of removal of 5070

comment.narrative:
Nutrients
N 32 mgl
P 9 mgl

Nutrients
N lt 10 mgl
P lt 4 mgl

2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015
N mgl 0137 0094 0050 00852 01410 01045 01222 01666 01778 02128
P mgl 0068 0093 0077 01250 01333 01060 01162 01497 01209 01581
This information was obtained through the Environmental Monitoring System for the Havana Bay which provides as a systematic task monitoring key indicators of ecosystems quality The objectives of this monitoring are to define the current level of pollution in the Bay and its evolution due to control and mitigation measures of pollution that have been implemented
This information merely aims to provide a snapshot of the current ecosystem status
The results of the ammonium nitrogen showed an increase in the three measurement levels compared to the previous years
In the case of the concentrations total phosphorus the results were higher than the previous years in surface and middle level This indicator shows a slight tendency to the increase in the superficial level however in the middle and bottom level the tendency is to decrease
The annual average concentrations of ammonia nitrogen NNH4 at all measurement levels were higher than 357 mol L1 which is the minimum limit for considering the poor quality water according to the Cuban Standard NC 25 1999 for the assessment of water resources for fishery
The average concentrations of total phosphorus PT in the superficial level were higher than 25 mol L1 considered as indicative inferior limit of eutrophic systems corresponding to the Cuban Standard mentioned above
The nutrients increased with respect to the previous year and a tendency to the slight increase is observed in the last four years
The concentrations of nutrients in general continue high
Longterm sustainability of all measures to rehabilitate the bay is of great importance as well as the continuity of the implemented environmental monitoring system
The entry into operation of the wastewater treatment plant Luyano IV and the others wastewaters treatment plants which are in construction at the moment in the tributary basin of the bay will contribute to decrease the nutrient concentrations in the Havana bay

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDPâs results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDPâs projects contributed to
Extent to which legal frameworks are in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems
Extent to which policy frameworks are in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems
Extent to which institutional frameworks are in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems
Extent to which capacities to protect and restore the health, productivity and resilience of oceans and marine ecosystems, have improved

This project will make a paradigm shift in biodiversity conservation and protected area management in Cuba, from a site based approach to a landscape approach that integrates Protected Areas into the surrounding areas. This is necessary in order to protect core refugia for biodiversity, while addressing fragmentation from production practices in the landscape as a whole, and countering threats such as fire and pollution which have their origins in the practices employed in the production landscape. Hence, the strategic landscape approach supported through this project will constitute an innova
